page.title: 17CLOSE HOUSE AND ELDON
page.content: These are local examples of run-down, formerly thriving,{mining communities. The majority of men would have worked in the nearby{Black Boy Colliery}which closed down within the last twenty years. Only thirty years ago{few}of the {houses}in Close House were{equipped with{W.C.s}and the{roads}were{unpaved. Now the houses, in typical terraced {"pit rows"}have been modernised and the{close-knit community}still survives, though surrounded yet by {derelict land}and relics of the old {mining industry,-}the public baths (now a car-breaker's yard and warehouse), for example. The former {pit heaps}have been{landscaped}and the quarry is being filled, used as an industrial refuse tip. Part of this land is now a{gypsy residential{caravan site.
